title: Vist - TV Show App
description: This application puts all of the relevant TV guide information in one neat interface. VIST allows TV viewers to create a catalog of shows that they want to watch or are currently watching.

title: MERN - User Framework
description: After working on the backend for VIST, I decided to compartmentalize that framework since it was a pain to find all the resources on how to set it all up. This way I can start with this for any future projects I want to create with a user and MERN framework.

title: Google Book Finder - React
description: React App that uses google book api to display books, store them to a page and allows you to make comments as well. I plan on remaking with the VIST overlay and user framework as they are similar apps.

title: Barrens Chat Generator
description: This app was designed to do one simple thing, generate Chuck Norris jokes quick and easy.

title: Employee Scheduler
description: Small Company scheduler is a simple app that was designed for creating a quick an easy way a small company could schedule employees for their time.

title: Mongo News-Scraper
description: Mongo Scraper is a news scraper website. It is designed to scrape articles from different news sites and pull them into a MongoDB database.

title: Home Manager
description: Home Manager is a tool for keeping track of what items you have, and how many of each.

title: Trivia Game
description: A mobile responsive Trivia game. It has two difficulty settings and currently two word banks.

title: Giftastic
description: Purpose: The purpose of this website design is to generate random GIFs using the giphy API. This is to give users default buttons to click but then also add their own when needed.

title: Superhero - Word Guess Game
description: A word guess game for superheros. Very simple deployment with basic HTMl/CSS/JS.

title: BAMazon
description: This application is a node.js storefront using the npm inquirer package and the MySQL database together with the npm mysql package. It also uses the npm table package to make our display look more uniform for the command line.
